member.name: P:Castle.ActiveRecord.ActiveRecordAttribute.Lazy
member.summary: Enable lazy loading for the type

member.name: P:Castle.ActiveRecord.ActiveRecordAttribute.DynamicUpdate
member.summary: Specifies that UPDATE SQL should be generated at runtime and contain only those columns whose values have changed.

member.name: P:Castle.ActiveRecord.ActiveRecordAttribute.DynamicInsert
member.summary: Specifies that INSERT SQL should be generated at runtime and contain only the columns whose values are not null.

member.name: T:Castle.ActiveRecord.BelongsToAttribute

member.name: M:Castle.ActiveRecord.BelongsToAttribute.#ctor(System.String)

member.summary: Defines the target type of the association. It's usually inferred from the property type.

member.summary: Defines the cascading behavior of this association.

member.summary: Defines the outer join behavior of this association.

member.summary: Defines whether this association will be included in database INSERTs or not.

member.name: P:Castle.ActiveRecord.BelongsToAttribute.NotNull
member.summary: Indicates whether this association allows nulls or not.

member.name: P:Castle.ActiveRecord.BelongsToAttribute.Unique

member.name: M:Castle.ActiveRecord.ActiveRecordBaseQuery.GetResultsArray(System.Type,System.Collections.IList,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Converts the results stored in an to an strongly-typed array.
member.param: The type of the new array
If true, only distinct results will be inserted in the array
member.returns: The strongly-typed array

member.name: M:Castle.ActiveRecord.ActiveRecordBaseQuery.GetResultsArray(System.Type,System.Collections.IList,System.Int32,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Converts the results stored in an to an strongly-typed array.
member.param: The type of the new array

If the HQL clause selects more than one field, or a join is performed without using fetch join, the contents of the result list will be of type object[]. Specify which index in this array should be used to compose the new result array. Use -1 to ignore this parameter.
If true, only distinct results will be inserted in the array
member.returns: The strongly-typed array

member.name: T:Castle.ActiveRecord.Framework.Scopes.AbstractScope
member.summary: Abstract implementation

member.name: T:Castle.ActiveRecord.ISessionScope
member.summary: Contract for implementation of scopes.
member.remarks:
A scope can implement a logic that affects AR for the scope lifetime. Session cache and transaction are the best examples, but you can create new scopes adding new semantics.
The methods on this interface are mostly invoked by the implementation

member.name: M:Castle.ActiveRecord.ISessionScope.RegisterSession(System.Object,NHibernate.ISession)
member.summary: This method is invoked when no session was available at and the just created one. So it registers the session created within this scope using a key. The scope implementation shouldn't make any assumption on what the key actually is as we reserve the right to change it

member.name: M:Castle.ActiveRecord.ISessionScope.IsKeyKnown(System.Object)
member.summary:
This method is invoked when the
instance needs a session instance. Instead of creating one it interrogates the active scope for one. The scope implementation must check if it has a session registered for the given key.
member.returns: true if the key exists within this scope instance

member.name: M:Castle.ActiveRecord.ISessionScope.GetSession(System.Object)
member.summary: This method should return the session instance associated with the key.
member.returns: the session instance or null if none was found

member.name: T:Castle.ActiveRecord.Framework.Scopes.AbstractThreadScopeInfo
member.summary: Base implementation. It's up to derived classes to provide a correct implementation of CurrentStack only

member.name: T:Castle.ActiveRecord.Framework.Scopes.DifferentDatabaseScope
member.summary: Still very experimental and it's not bullet proof for all situations

member.name: T:Castle.ActiveRecord.SessionScope
member.summary: Implementation of to augment performance by caching the session, thus avoiding too much opens/flushes/closes.

member.name: T:Castle.ActiveRecord.Framework.Scopes.ThreadScopeAccessor
member.summary: Class to allow scopes to reach the implementation of . Also implements the delegating the calls to the scope set.

member.name: T:Castle.ActiveRecord.ActiveRecordBase
member.summary: Base class for all ActiveRecord classes. Implements all the functionality to simplify the code on the subclasses.

member.name: T:Castle.ActiveRecord.ActiveRecordHooksBase
member.summary: Base class for ActiveRecord entities that are interested in NHibernate's hooks.

member.name: M:Castle.ActiveRecord.ActiveRecordHooksBase.BeforeSave(System.Collections.IDictionary)
member.summary: Hook to change the object state before saving it.
member.returns: Return true if you have changed the state. false otherwise

member.name: M:Castle.ActiveRecord.ActiveRecordHooksBase.BeforeLoad(System.Collections.IDictionary)
member.summary: Hook to transform the read data from the database before populating the object instance
member.returns: Return true if you have changed the state. false otherwise

member.name: M:Castle.ActiveRecord.ActiveRecordHooksBase.BeforeDelete(System.Collections.IDictionary)
member.summary: Hook to perform additional tasks before removing the object instance representation from the database.

member.name: M:Castle.ActiveRecord.ActiveRecordHooksBase.PreFlush
member.summary: Called before a flush

member.name: M:Castle.ActiveRecord.ActiveRecordHooksBase.PostFlush
member.summary: Called after a flush that actually ends in execution of the SQL statements required to synchronize in-memory state with the database.

member.name: M:Castle.ActiveRecord.ActiveRecordHooksBase.IsUnsaved
member.summary: Called when a transient entity is passed to SaveOrUpdate.
member.remarks:
The return value determines if the object is saved
true - the entity is passed to Save(), resulting in an INSERT
false - the entity is passed to Update(), resulting in an UPDATE
null - Hibernate uses the unsaved-value mapping to determine if the object is unsaved

member.name: M:Castle.ActiveRecord.ActiveRecordHooksBase.FindDirty(System.Object,System.Collections.IDictionary,System.Collections.IDictionary,NHibernate.Type.IType[])
member.summary: Called from Flush(). The return value determines whether the entity is updated

list.item: an array of property indicies - the entity is dirty
an empty array - the entity is not dirty
null - use Hibernate's default dirty-checking algorithm

member.returns: An array of dirty property indicies or null to choose default behavior

member.name: M:Castle.ActiveRecord.ActiveRecordHooksBase.OnSave
member.summary: Lifecycle method invoked during Save of the entity

member.name: M:Castle.ActiveRecord.ActiveRecordHooksBase.OnUpdate
member.summary: Lifecycle method invoked during Update of the entity

member.name: M:Castle.ActiveRecord.ActiveRecordHooksBase.OnDelete

member.name: T:Castle.ActiveRecord.Framework.Internal.ARSchemaCreator
member.summary: Used to execute a script file to create/update/drop a database schema. Inspired on NHibernate SchemaExport class.

member.name: T:Castle.ActiveRecord.Framework.DictionaryAdapter
member.summary: Maps keys to position in the values array. Basically key -> index

member.name: T:Castle.ActiveRecord.Framework.HookDispatcher
member.summary: Translates the IInterceptor messages to instance possible hooks

member.name: M:Castle.ActiveRecord.Framework.HookDispatcher.OnLoad(System.Object,System.Object,System.Object[],System.String[],NHibernate.Type.IType[])
member.summary: Called just before an object is initialized
member.remarks: The interceptor may change the state, which will be propagated to the persistent object. Note that when this method is called, entity will be an empty uninitialized instance of the class.
member.returns: true if the user modified the state in any way

member.name: M:Castle.ActiveRecord.Framework.HookDispatcher.OnFlushDirty(System.Object,System.Object,System.Object[],System.Object[],System.String[],NHibernate.Type.IType[])
member.summary: Called when an object is detected to be dirty, during a flush.
member.remarks: The interceptor may modify the detected currentState, which will be propagated to both the database and the persistent object. Note that all flushes end in an actual synchronization with the database, in which as the new currentState will be propagated to the object, but not necessarily (immediately) to the database. It is strongly recommended that the interceptor not modify the previousState.
member.returns: true if the user modified the currentState in any way

member.name: M:Castle.ActiveRecord.Framework.HookDispatcher.OnSave(System.Object,System.Object,System.Object[],System.String[],NHibernate.Type.IType[])
member.summary: Called before an object is saved
member.remarks: The interceptor may modify the state, which will be used for the SQL INSERT and propagated to the persistent object
member.returns: true if the user modified the state in any way

member.name: M:Castle.ActiveRecord.Framework.HookDispatcher.OnDelete(System.Object,System.Object,System.Object[],System.String[],NHibernate.Type.IType[])
member.summary: Called before an object is deleted
member.remarks: It is not recommended that the interceptor modify the state.

member.name: M:Castle.ActiveRecord.Framework.HookDispatcher.PreFlush(System.Collections.ICollection)
member.summary: Called before a flush

member.name: M:Castle.ActiveRecord.Framework.HookDispatcher.PostFlush(System.Collections.ICollection)
member.summary: Called after a flush that actually ends in execution of the SQL statements required to synchronize in-memory state with the database.

member.name: M:Castle.ActiveRecord.Framework.HookDispatcher.IsUnsaved(System.Object)
member.summary: Called when a transient entity is passed to SaveOrUpdate.
member.remarks:
The return value determines if the object is saved
true - the entity is passed to Save(), resulting in an INSERT
false - the entity is passed to Update(), resulting in an UPDATE
null - Hibernate uses the unsaved-value mapping to determine if the object is unsaved

member.name: M:Castle.ActiveRecord.Framework.HookDispatcher.FindDirty(System.Object,System.Object,System.Object[],System.Object[],System.String[],NHibernate.Type.IType[])
member.summary: Called from Flush(). The return value determines whether the entity is updated

list.item: an array of property indicies - the entity is dirty
an empty array - the entity is not dirty
null - use Hibernate's default dirty-checking algorithm

member.returns: An array of dirty property indicies or null to choose default behavior

member.name: M:Castle.ActiveRecord.Framework.HookDispatcher.Instantiate(System.Type,System.Object)
member.summary: Instantiate the entity class. Return null to indicate that Hibernate should use the default constructor of the class
member.param: The identifier of the new instance
member.returns: An instance of the class, or null to choose default behaviour

member.name: T:Castle.ActiveRecord.Framework.ISessionFactoryHolder
member.summary: Keeps an association of SessionFactories to a object model tree;

member.summary: Associates a Configuration object to a root type

member.name: M:Castle.ActiveRecord.Framework.ISessionFactoryHolder.GetAllConfigurations
member.summary: Pendent

member.name: M:Castle.ActiveRecord.Framework.ISessionFactoryHolder.GetConfiguration(System.Type)
member.summary: Requests the Configuration associated to the type.

member.name: T:Castle.ActiveRecord.Framework.SupportingUtils

member.name: M:Castle.ActiveRecord.Framework.SupportingUtils.BuildArray(System.Type,System.Collections.IEnumerable,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Converts the results stored in an to an strongly-typed array.
member.param: The type of the new array
If true, only distinct results will be inserted in the array
member.returns: The strongly-typed array

member.name: M:Castle.ActiveRecord.Framework.SupportingUtils.BuildArray(System.Type,System.Collections.IEnumerable,System.Int32,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Converts the results stored in an to an strongly-typed array.
member.param: The type of the new array

If the HQL clause selects more than one field, or a join is performed without using fetch join, the contents of the result list will be of type object[]. Specify which index in this array should be used to compose the new result array. Use -1 to ignore this parameter.
If true, only distinct results will be inserted in the array
member.returns: The strongly-typed array

member.param: The class of the object which will be created for each row contained in the supplied .
If true, only distinct results will be inserted in the array
member.returns: The strongly-typed array
member.remarks: A good alternative is to use the new
